title: Honoring Ellen Bernstein Fox upon the occasion of her designation for special recognition by the Port Washington Education Foundation
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Ellen Bernstein Fox upon the occasion of
her designation for special recognition by the Port Washington Education
Foundation

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Ellen Bernstein Fox has given not only of her time and  ener-
gies  but also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and conse-
quently has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to  honor  Ellen  Bern-
stein  Fox  upon the occasion of her designation for special recognition
by the Port Washington Education Foundation on Saturday, April 9,  2011;
and
  WHEREAS,  Currently  the  Vice  President of Port Washington Education
Foundation's Project Development  Committee,  Ellen  Bernstein  Fox  has
brilliantly  led  the  organization's Education Support Center since its
inception; and
  WHEREAS, Second generation  and  life-long  Port  Washington  resident
Ellen Bernstein Fox is credited with starting the Port Washington Educa-
tion  Foundation  (PWEF)  Education  Support  Center; begun in 2004, the
Center serves over 40 third graders in a weekly program that focuses  on
literacy skill; and
  WHEREAS,  A devoted volunteer, Ellen Bernstein Fox has been the Presi-
dent of Manorhaven PTA and Parent Council;  while  President  of  Parent
Council, she initiated the Community Holiday Drive, an annual event that
brings  numerous  parent  volunteers together to donate holiday gifts of
food, clothing and toys for Port Washington families in need; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Ellen Bernstein Fox upon  the  occasion  of  her  designation  for
special  recognition by the Port Washington Education Foundation; and be
it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Ellen Bernstein Fox.
